item.title: Configuring Git and Go for private modules without netrc
item.description: So far, I had used the personal tokens method for authorizing myself against GitHub when working with private modules, but now I figured out how to make it work directly with Git and my SSH config already existing. TL;DR; # vim ft=gitconfig # ~/.gitconfig [url "ssh://git@github.com/nrxr"] insteadOf = https://github.com/nrxr [url "ssh://git@x.github.com/employer"] insteadOf = https://github.com/employer # vim ft=sshconfig # ~/.ssh/config Host x.github.com HostName github.com IdentityFile %d/path/to/employer-configure-ssh-key Now the long version: I do have separate GitHub accounts for my personal stuff and work.
